Subscription timer component is configured in such a way that it accepts Start date and Expiry date in UTC format, based on the difference between the start and expiry dates, timer is shown in two states

1. Pre-Expiry (in UTC)
2. Post-Expiry (in UTC)

User to provide appropriate labels to subscription timer component for template to bind.

The component can be used as

<cmp-subscriptiontimer start-date-utc="2019-02-06T06:59Z" expiry-date-utc="2018-03-06T10:23Z" show-timer="true" before-expiry-label="Your Subscription expires in" after-expiry-label="Your Subscription Expired" after-expiry-additional-label="ago" day-label="day(s)" hour-label="hour(s)" min-label="min(s)" sec-label="sec(s)" ></cmp-subscriptiontimer>

Timeout component has no html template to display and is configured in such a way that it accepts 2 properties
1. alert inactivity (in milliseconds)
2. post inactivity wait time (in milliseconds)

Alert inactivity prop is used to show the alert to user if inactivity is detected on the web page for the mentioned time in milliseconds

Post inactivity wait time prop is used to wait for user action after the alert is shown to the user.

1. If user clicks "ok" before the wait time, then he can still access the page
2. If user clicks "cancel", then time out logic to be performed
3. If user clicks "ok" after the wait time, then time out logic to be performed

(Please open the console to check the status of your page timeout)

The component can be used as
<cmp-timeout :alert-inactivity-millis="5000" :post-inactivity-wait-till-millis="10000" ></cmp-timeout>
